statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: Cornell 71, Harvard 44
article.story: BOSTON (AP) -- Adam Gore led Cornell with 16 points and Brian Kreefer added 14 as the Big Red handed Harvard its eighth straight loss, 71-44. Cornell (12-15, 7-6 Ivy League) shot 8-of-12 from 3-point range in the first half to open up a big lead it wouldn't relinquish. The Big Red hit its first five 3-pointers for a 15-5 edge over Harvard (12-14, 4-9 Ivy). Kreefer and Gore led Cornell with four 3-pointers apiece for the game. While Cornell was hitting from the outside, Harvard had a hard time getting anything going offensively. The Crimson shot 30 percent from the floor and committed 13 turnovers in the first half as Cornell gained a 37-22 advantage at the break. The Crimson scored a season low in points and shot a season-low 28 percent from the floor for the contest. Brian Cusworth, Matt Stehle and Michael Beal all scored nine points for Harvard, while Cusworth added a game-high 11 rebounds. The Big Red continued building its lead in the second half, expanding it to as much as 29 at 71-42. David Lisle added 10 points for Cornell, which is also the team that started Harvard's losing streak.
